Notes: First try for Bluegill; RSO had problems before launch, and at 5 minutes tracking was lost. Destroyed at t+15 minutes, before time of intended explosion.

Local time zone [note 2][26]: jamt (-11 hrs)Believed in use during Dominic, Fishbowl, HT I.[27]
Notes: First try for Starfish; rocket failed at 59 seconds, destroyed by RSO at 65 secs, weapon single point failed without nuclear reaction.

Local time zone [note 2][26]: jamt (-11 hrs)Believed in use during Dominic, Fishbowl, HT I.[27]
Location [note 3]: Launch from Johnston Island, Johnston Atoll 16°44′01″N 169°31′31″W﻿ / ﻿16.73365°N 169.52534°W, elv: 3 + 0 m (9.8 + 0.0 ft);Detonation over Johnston Island, Johnston Atoll 16°28′06″N 169°37′48″W﻿ / ﻿16.46842°N 169.63008°W
Notes: Fishbowl; high altitude effects test, W-49 warhead/Mk-4 RV on Thor missile. Burst seen in Hawaii, Kwajelein (1,600 mi (2,600 km) away), EMP effects in Oahu. Destroyed several satellites, including Telstar I, with radiation belt.

Local time zone [note 2][26]: jamt (-11 hrs)Believed in use during Dominic, Fishbowl, HT I.[27]
Notes: Very high altitude Thor-delivered 1 Mt bomb test cancelled for fear of destroying satellites.

Local time zone [note 2][26]: jamt (-11 hrs)Believed in use during Dominic, Fishbowl, HT I.[27]
Notes: Second try for Bluegill; a valve in the engine malfunctioned, causing abort launch, and RSO destroyed it in the pad.  Complete rebuild of contaminated pad required.

Local time zone [note 2][26]: jamt (-11 hrs)Believed in use during Dominic, Fishbowl, HT I.[27]
Notes: Third try for Bluegill; booster failure at 86 seconds and rocket started tumbling, RSO destroyed rocket at 156 seconds. Some debris rained on Johnston Island.
